abstract: National City became only the latest bank to seek additional funds in the wake of the housing market slump, unveiling a plan on Monday to raise $7 billion from a group of investors. The bank, the tenth-largest in the United States, is now following in the footsteps of a score of peers — from Citigroup to Washington Mutual — to rely on a big infusion by outsiders.
